intro: Lissochilus lokobensis, commonly known as the Lokobénensis orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually pale purple or white with intricate patterns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
